name: smarty
description: Syntax highlighting for the Smarty templating language.

default.name: capitalize
default.description:
This is used to capitalize the first letter of all words in a variable. This is similar to the PHP `ucwords()` function. 
> *Test message*

default.name: cat
default.description: This value is concatenated to the given variable.

default.name: count_characters
default.description: This is used to count the number of characters in a variable.

default.name: count_paragraphs
default.description: This is used to count the number of paragraphs in a variable.

default.name: count_sentences
default.description: This is used to count the number of sentences in a variable. A sentence being delimited by a dot, question- or exclamation-mark (.?!).

default.name: count_words
default.description: This is used to count the number of words in a variable.

default.name: date_format
default.description:
This formats a date and time into the given `strftime()` format. Dates can be passed to Smarty as unix timestamps, DateTime objects, mysql timestamps or any string made up of month day year, parsable by php's `strtotime()`.
Designers can then use `date_format` to have complete control of the formatting of the date. If the date passed to `date_format` is empty and a second parameter is passed, that will be used as the date to format.

default.name: default
default.description: This is used to set a default value for a variable. If the variable is unset or an empty string, the given default value is printed instead. Default takes the one argument.

default.name: escape
default.description: `escape` is used to encode or escape a variable to `html`, `url`, `single quotes`, `hex`, `hexentity`, `javascript` and `mail`. By default its `html`.

default.name: from_charset
default.description: `from_charset` is used to transcode a string from a given charset to the internal charset. This is the exact opposite of the `to_charset` modifier.

default.name: indent
default.description: This indents a string on each line, default is 4. As an optional parameter, you can specify the number of characters to indent. As an optional second parameter, you can specify the character to use to indent with eg use "	" for a tab.

default.name: lower
default.description: This is used to lowercase a variable. This is equivalent to the PHP `strtolower()` function.

default.name: nl2br
default.description:
All `" "` line breaks will be converted to html `
` tags in the given variable. This is equivalent to the PHP's `nl2br()` function.

default.name: regex_replace
default.description: A regular expression search and replace on a variable. Use the `preg_replace()` syntax from the PHP manual.

default.name: replace
default.description: A simple search and replace on a variable. This is equivalent to the PHP's `str_replace()` function.

default.name: spacify
default.description: `spacify` is a way to insert a space between every character of a variable. You can optionally pass a different character or string to insert.

default.name: string_format
default.description: This is a way to format strings, such as decimal numbers and such. Use the syntax for `sprintf()` for the formatting.

default.name: strip
default.description: This replaces all spaces, newlines and tabs with a single space, or with the supplied string.

default.name: strip_tags
default.description: This strips out markup tags, basically anything between `<` and `>`.

default.name: to_charset
default.description: `to_charset` is used to transcode a string from the internal charset to a given charset. This is the exact opposite of the `from_charset` modifier.

default.name: truncate
default.description: This truncates a variable to a character length, the default is 80. As an optional second parameter, you can specify a string of text to display at the end if the variable was truncated. The characters in the string are included with the original truncation length. By default, `truncate` will attempt to cut off at a word boundary. If you want to cut off at the exact character length, pass the optional third parameter of `TRUE`.

default.name: unescape
default.description: `unescape` is used to decode `entity`, `html` and `htmlall`. It counters the effects of the `escape` modifier for the given types.

default.name: upper
default.description: This is used to uppercase a variable. This is equivalent to the PHP `strtoupper()` function.

default.name: wordwrap
default.description:
Wraps a string to a column width, the default is 80. As an optional second parameter, you can specify a string of text to wrap the text to the next line, the default is a carriage return `"
"`. By default, `wordwrap` will attempt to wrap at a word boundary. If you want to cut off at the exact character length, pass the optional third parameter as `TRUE`. This is equivalent to the PHP `wordwrap()` function.
